subject: Self Care
title: Naming Your Emotions
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Naming Your Emotions.

hook.text: Asked how they feel, most adults say 'fine' or 'stressed.' Children can name twenty emotions. Adults forgot.

buildup.text: Emotional granularity is the ability to make fine distinctions between emotions. It's a trainable skill.

discovery.text: UCLA research showed that labeling an emotion â€” 'I feel frustrated' â€” reduces its intensity almost instantly.

twist.text: 'I'm stressed' is too vague. Are you overwhelmed? Anxious? Exhausted? Each requires a different response.

climax.text: Expand your emotional vocabulary. The more precisely you name the feeling, the better you can respond to it.

punchline.text: Name the emotion precisely. That alone calms it.

quiz.question: What does research show about labeling emotions?
options: It reduces their intensity almost instantly
